{{Infobox person | name = Sandy Kemper | caption = | birth_name = Alexander Sandy Kemper | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1965|06|18}} | birth_place = [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]], U.S. | residence = [[Kansas City]] | known for = Chairman and CEO UMB Financial Corporation, Chairman of Global Trading Web Association | education = [[Northwestern University]] ([[Bachelor of Arts|BA]]) | alma_mater = | employer = | occupation = [[Entrepreneur]] | years_active = | spouse = Christine Kemper | partner = | children = | parents = | website = }}
'''Alexander Sandy Kemper''' (born June 18, 1965) is an [[United States|American]] [[entrepreneur]], known for being founder and board chairman of Agriculture Future of America, founder of Education, Inc., chairman of Global Trading Web Association, founder of The Collector’s Fund, and founder and CEO Perfect Commerce, formerly known as eScout. Kemper is the [[Chairman|chairman of the board]] and [[chief executive officer]] of C2FO.
==Early life and education== Kemper was born in [[Chicago]] in 1965 and raised in the [[Kansas City metropolitan area|Kansas City]] area by [[Adoption|adoptive]] parents Mary “Bebe” Kemper and [[R. Crosby Kemper, Jr.]] who died in 2014.<ref>{{cite web |title=R.Crosby Kemper Jr. Dies |url=http://www.kansascity.com/news/local/article335212/R.-Crosby-Kemper-Jr.-dies-in-California.html |website=kansascity.com |publisher=The Kansas City Star |accessdate=September 25, 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141111091744/http://www.kansascity.com/news/local/article335212/R.-Crosby-Kemper-Jr.-dies-in-California.html |archivedate=November 11, 2014}}</ref> He received a bachelor's in history from [[Northwestern University]] in 1987.<ref name="LIAK">{{cite web |title=Alexander (Sandy) Kemper |url=https://www.linkedin.com/pub/alexander-sandy-kemper/12/668/b23 |website=linkedin.com |publisher=linkedin |accessdate=September 25, 2015}}</ref>
==Career and later years== {{Very long|section|date=August 2018}} Kemper grew up in a family of bankers. While still in college, he started working with [[Continental Illinois]] Bank as an analyst in the treasury management division.{{citation needed|date=September 2015}} Following graduation, he returned to Kansas City and, between 1995 and 2000, moved up through the ranks to become chairman and CEO of UMB Bank, founded in 1919 and run by a succession of family members,<ref>{{cite web |title=Bank History |url=https://www.umb.com/AboutUMB/Company/OurHistory/index.htm |website=umb.com |publisher=UMB Financial Corporation |accessdate=September 25, 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150925185702/https://www.umb.com/AboutUMB/Company/OurHistory/index.htm |archivedate=September 25, 2015}}</ref> and CEO and President of [[UMB Financial Corporation]].
The first company he founded, Education Inc., was a program that created a series of schools within public schools inside the Kansas City Public School district. Under his leadership, Education, Inc. grew to serve nearly 1,000 at-risk students in the Kansas City Missouri School District, giving them extended academic instruction, additional social services support, and mentors in the community to provide support and leadership.{{citation needed|date=September 2015}}
Kemper has been recognized as a "Top banker in the US,” by ''American Banker'', and in numerous local publications as a leader and entrepreneur in the business community. Featured in media outlets such as ''The Wall Street Journal'', Bloomberg,<ref>[https://www.bloomberg.com/video/creating-short-term-investment-income-_bnrYd0nRRqP5npQN0uslQ.html Bloomberg TV: Pollenware]. Bloomberg TV, September 12, 2012.</ref><ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E7M84Zj3e8U Bloomberg TV: Pollenware]. Bloomberg TV, October 30, 2013.</ref> CNN, CNBC <ref>[https://video.cnbc.com/gallery/?video=3000427638 “Shake It Up”]. CNBC October 1, 2015.</ref> National Public Radio and ''The Financial Times''. Kemper has been widely recognized as a leader in [[B2B e-commerce]] and supply chain financial health.<ref name="Introducing the Forbes Finch 50">[https://www.forbes.com/sites/janetnovack/2015/12/09/introducing-the-forbes-fintech-50/ "Introducing the Forbes Finch 50"]. Forbes Magazine December 28, 2015.</ref>
Following his tenure at UMB Financial Corporation, he founded and served as the Chairman and CEO of Perfect Commerce <ref>[http://on.wsj.com/1xhJoXY “Banking On Change”]. Wall Street Journal July 17, 2000.</ref>(formerly eScout LLC), a provider of supplier relationship management technology. Under his leadership, Perfect Commerce created the Open Supplier Network™ (OSN™) and became a provider of on-demand supplier relationship management (SRM) technology to businesses across the globe. Perfect Commerce expanded to become the world’s single largest independent supplier network, with over 500,000 suppliers.<ref>{{cite web |title=Who We Are |url=http://www.perfect.com/about/who-we-are/ |website=perfect.com |publisher=Perfect Commerce |accessdate=July 2, 2015 }}</ref> In 2001, he was named chairman of the Global Trading Web Association.<ref>[http://www.bizjournals.com/kansascity/stories/2001/07/23/daily7.html “eScout's Kemper will chair Global Trading Web Association”]. Kansas City Business Journal July 23, 2001.</ref><ref>[https://www.internetretailer.com/mobile/2001/07/24/global-trading-web-association-announces-election-of-sandy-kempe "Global Trading Web Association Announces Election of Sandy Kemper as Chairman"]. Internet Retailer July 24, 2001.</ref> Kemper retired as chairman and CEO of Perfect Commerce in 2006.
In 2006, Kemper co-founded The Collectors Fund (TCF), the first art fund in the United States.<ref>[http://www.bizjournals.com/kansascity/stories/2009/03/02/story2.html “The Collectors Fund brings a new aesthetic to the art of investing”]. Kansas City Business Journal March 1, 2009.</ref> In addition to creating and managing The Kansas City Collection program, TCF also serves as the management company for the American Masters Collection and the Twentieth Century Masters Collection, two art ownership and investment funds for over 100 member families and businesses across the United States.<ref>[http://www.bizjournals.com/kansascity/print-edition/2011/05/27/the-collectors-fund-hopes-to-craft-a.html “The Collectors Fund hopes to craft a second masterpiece of returns for investors"]. Kansas City Business Journal May 27, 2011.</ref> The collections comprise works by many of the most recognized American artists of the 20th and 21st centuries. Their distinguished features include the art rotation program that allows members to enjoy museum-quality art in their homes,<ref>{{cite web |title=Art market funds are offering masterful returns |url=https://www.minnpost.com/business-agenda/2011/04/art-market-funds-are-offering-masterful-returns |website=minnpost.com |publisher=Minn Post |accessdate=September 25, 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150925191800/https://www.minnpost.com/business-agenda/2011/04/art-market-funds-are-offering-masterful-returns |archivedate=September 25, 2015}}</ref> and unique educational events around the country.
In 2007, Kemper founded his next tech company, [[C2FO]]. It is a financial technology company and the creator of the first market for working capital. C2FO operates the C2FO working capital market for companies of all sizes around the world.<ref>[http://upstart.bizjournals.com/entrepreneurs/hot-shots/2016/08/12/how-this-entrepreneur-creates-entirely-new-markets.html "C2FO's Sandy Kemper: How this entrepreneur creates entirely new markets"]. Kansas City Business Journal August 12, 2016.</ref> C2FO has earned the attention and backing of venture firm Union Square Ventures,<ref>[http://www.usv.com/blog/pollenware "Pollenware (C2FO)"]. Union Square Ventures blog September 5, 2012.</ref> which is well known for investments in other fast-growing companies like [[Twitter]] and [[Zynga]]. C2FO is also backed by other venture capital firms including Peter Thiel's Mithril Capital Management,<ref>{{cite web |title=Mithril Capital Management |url=https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/mithril-capital-management |website=crunchbase.com |publisher=CrunchBase |accessdate=September 25, 2015}}</ref> Tiger Global<ref>{{cite web |title=Tiger Global Management |url=https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/tiger-global |website=crunchbase.com |publisher=CrunchBase |accessdate=September 25, 2015}}</ref> and Summerhill Venture Partners.<ref>{{cite web |title=Summerhill Venture Partners |url=https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/summerhill-venture-partners |website=crunchbase.com |publisher=CrunchBase |accessdate=September 25, 2015}}</ref>
In 2013, Kemper was invited by the U.S. Treasury to discuss innovative solutions to improve access to capital for American businesses in order to spur the country’s economic growth. U.S. Treasury Secretary Jacob J. Lew delivered opening remarks at the summit and Gene Sperling, National Economic Council Director, closed the event. They were joined by SBA Administrator Karen Mills and other thought leaders found throughout the business and finance communities.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://c2fo.com/press/c2fo-invited-by-u-s-treasury-to-participate-in-the-capital-access-innovation-summit |title=Invited by U.S. Treasury to Participate in the Capital Access Innovation Summit |publisher=C2fo.com |date= |accessdate=2015-04-07}}</ref> Kemper has also been a featured speaker at the [[World Bank]].<ref>[http://info.worldbank.org/etools/docs/library/159695/smetech/kemper.html “Presenter Bios:Sandy Kemper”]. World Bank Group 2001.</ref>
In October 2015, C2FO reported its Q3 2015 working capital flows of $8.7BN, five times the rate compared to $1.7BN in Q3 2014. The market generated $1.1BN in volume in a single week.<ref>[http://www.bizjournals.com/kansascity/news/2015/10/19/c2fo-volume-skyrockets-to-1b-a-week.html "C2FO volume skyrockets to $1B a week"]. Kansas City Business Journal October 19, 2015.</ref> C2FO’s client base includes Amazon, Kellogg's, Macy's, Hanes, Walgreens, HP, Nordstrom, Sysco, ULTA Beauty, Pfizer, Toys R Us, Dannon, Costco <ref>[http://www.marketwatch.com/story/the-c2fo-market-announces-extension-with-costco-wholesale-corp-2014-03-31?reflink=MW_news_stmp "The C2FO market announces extension with Costco"]. Marketwatch March 31, 2014.</ref> and Mothercare,<ref>[http://www.retailtechnology.co.uk/news/5936/mothercare-launches-early-payment-service/ "Mothercare Launches Early Payment Service"]. Retail Technology May 9, 2016.</ref> among others. C2FO was named to the first Forbes Fintech 50 List in 2015 and 2016.<ref name="Introducing the Forbes Finch 50" /> <ref>[https://www.forbes.com/sites/janetnovack/2016/11/07/the-forbes-fintech-50-for-2016/#7abf80837cbd "The Forbes Fintech 50 For 2016"]. Forbes November 7, 2016.</ref>
In 2018, he was named to a national list of the top 100 most influential financial executives. The Business Journals' Influencers list spotlights 100 executives who are having an impact on business being done in communities nationwide. <ref>[https://www.bizjournals.com/kansascity/news/2018/09/10/jeff-jones-sandy-kemper-100-finance-influencers.html#g/440280/47 "The Business Journal 100 Influencers 2018"]. The Business Journal September 10, 2018.</ref>
==Boards and philanthropy== Kemper currently sits on the board of UMB Financial Corporation (NASDAQ: UMBF), AXA Art Insurance (NYSE: AXA), and NIC (Nasdaq: EGOV) where he serves on the Audit committee and is Chairman of its Compensation committee.<ref>{{cite web |title=Alexander C. Kemper |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=506288&ticker=EGOV |website=bloomberg.com |publisher=Bloomberg L.P. |accessdate=September 25, 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150925193252/http://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=506288&ticker=EGOV |archivedate=September 25, 2015}}</ref> Kemper previously served on the boards of BATS and Cboe, two of the largest stock and options exchanges in the world. Kemper is a Trustee of the Enid and Crosby Kemper Charitable Trust, whose focus is primarily in giving to arts and education, and is also a Trustee for the [[Kemper Museum of Contemporary Art|Kemper Museum of Art.]]<ref>[https://www.kemperart.org/people "Kemper Art: People"] Kempertart.org</ref>
Kemper and his family are also engaged in a number of academic, civic and philanthropic endeavors. Kemper serves on the board of the Agriculture Future of America (AFA), a non-profit scholarship and leadership development organization, which he co-founded and has now grown to include more than 10,000 college scholars in active leadership development programs across the country.<ref>{{cite web |title=Agriculture Future of America |url=http://www.agfuture.org/s/1342/index.aspx?sid=1342&gid=1&pgid=325 |website=agfuture.org |publisher=Agriculture Future of America |accessdate=September 25, 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150925193926/http://www.agfuture.org/s/1342/index.aspx?sid=1342&gid=1&pgid=325 |archivedate=September 25, 2015}}</ref> Kemper and his wife, Christine, have served as the Co-Chairmen for the World War I Museum's ''Call to Duty'' campaign, and have raised nearly $20 Million to enable construction of a new exhibition gallery at the Museum and renovation of existing outdoor space, as well as amenities to enhance the visitor experience as a venue for community and corporate events.<ref>[https://theworldwar.s3.amazonaws.com/prod/s3fs-public/5-4-16_Capital_Campaign_Gallery_Release.pdf "KC Philanthropic Leaders Heed the “Call to Duty” Raising More than $5 Million to Construct New Exhibition Gallery at the National World War I Museum and Memorial"]. May 4, 2016.</ref> In 2016, Sandy and Christine co-founded YEPKC (Young Entrepreneurs Program, Kansas City) along with four other C2FO employees. YEPKC allows juniors and seniors in high school to develop and practice entrepreneurial skills and explore their interests through hands-on professional experience by interning with fast-growth and start-up businesses in the Kansas City area. <ref>[http://www.startlandnews.com/2017/10/sandy-kemper-led-yep-kc-primes-teen-entrepreneurs-for-success/ "Sandy Kemper-led YEP KC primes teen entrepreneurs for success"]. October 24, 2017.</ref> In 2017, the Henry W. Bloch School of Management named Sandy and Christine its Regional Entrepreneurs of the Year.<ref>[http://info.umkc.edu/blochnews/2017/10/11/henry-w-bloch-school-of-management-2017-entrepreneur-of-the-year-awards-honor-visionary-leaders/ "Henry W. Bloch School of Management 2017 Entrepreneur of the Year Awards Honor Visionary Leaders"]. October 11, 2017.</ref>
== Personal life == Kemper lives with his wife Christine Kemper and their four children in Kansas City.<ref name="LIAK" />
==References== {{Reflist|30em}}

{{EngvarB|date=January 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2018}} {{Infobox person | name = Sean Mulryan | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1954|09}} | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | restingplace = | nationality = | residence = County Kildare, Ireland | education = | alma mater = | occupation = Property developer | title = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | known for = founder, chairman and CEO, [[Ballymore Group]] | boards = | salary = | networth = | spouse = Bernadine Mulryan | parents = | children = 5 | relations = | website = }}
'''Sean Mulryan''' (born September 1954) is an Irish<ref name=Telegraph>''Telegraph'': [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/1528481/Revealed-the-reclusive-property-mogul-who-has-already-won-the-Olympics.html Revealed: the reclusive property mogul who has already won the Olympics], accessdate: 1 September 2014</ref> property developer, and the founder and chairman and CEO of the [[Ballymore Group]], a Dublin-based international property development company. He was named on the [[Estates Gazette]] 2017 'Power List', which lists the 50 most powerful individuals in Britain's commercial real estate sector. Mulryan was the only Irish person to be named on the list, which included US Billionaire and [[Amazon.com|Amazon]] founder [[Jeff Bezos]] and the Chairman of [[C C Land|CC Land]], Cheung Chung Kiu.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/business/commercial-property/mulryan-joins-jeff-bezos-on-uk-property-power-list-35875057.html|title=Mulryan joins Jeff Bezos on UK property 'power list' |work=The Irish Independent|access-date=10 July 2017}}</ref>
==Early life== Sean Mulryan was born in September 1954,<ref name=CH>{{cite web|title=BALLYMORE LIMITED|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04936525/officers|website=Companies House|accessdate=29 July 2015}}</ref> the son of John and Josephine Mulryan.<ref name=Telegraph/> He grew up in rural poverty in the village of Oran, near [[Castlerea]], Co Roscommon,<ref name=Telegraph/><ref name=SC/> in the west of Ireland, in a farming family with seven children.<ref name=HP>''Homes & Property'': [http://www.homesandproperty.co.uk/property-news/news/sean-mulryan-man-who-owns-land-every-corner-london Sean Mulryan: the man who owns land in every corner of Londo], accessdate: 1 September 2014</ref>
Mulryan left school at the age of 17, and trained as a bricklayer. Aged 19, he bought his first plot of land.<ref name=HP/> At 26 he set up his own company and shortly afterwards founded Ballymore, which is now considered one Europe's biggest property developers.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.roscommonpeople.ie/archive/55-archives/at-home-with-sean-mulryan|title=At home with Sean Mulryan – Roscommon People – The People's Paper|last=People|first=Roscommon|access-date=7 February 2017}}</ref>
==Ballymore Group== Ballymore Group was founded in 1982 by Mulryan, then aged 28, who is the chairman. David Brophy is the group chief executive.<ref name=PR>prnewswire.co.uk: [http://www.prnewswire.co.uk/news-releases/ballymore-announces-group-reorganisation-152879555.html Ballymore Announces Group Reorganisation – DUBLIN, July 3 /PR Newswire UK/ --], accessdate: 30 August 2014</ref>
Ballymore has become one of the biggest providers of residential space in London.<ref name=IrishTimes>irishtimes.com: [http://www.irishtimes.com/life-and-style/homes-and-property/the-irish-developer-with-a-big-vision-for-london-1.2284778 The Irish developer with a big vision for London --]</ref> In 2017, it was reported that the previous year's profits at the UK arm of Ballymore had increased almost three-fold to £154.9m (€217.6m).<ref name=Independent>independent.ie: [http://www.independent.ie/business/irish/exceptional-gains-push-sean-mulryans-ballymore-uk-profits-to-217m-34342258.html Exceptional gains push Sean Mulryan's Ballymore UK profits to €217m --]</ref>
Ballymore Group works on large-scale projects in London and across Europe, with a particular focus on urban regeneration.
In 2016, it was reported that Oran native Sean Mulryan launched the latest development in Dublin, which is a €700 million development in the docklands.<ref name=RoscommonDaily>roscommondaily.com: [http://roscommondaily.com/2016/10/oran-native-700m-ballymore/ Oran native launches €700m Ballymore development --]</ref>
Several members of the Mulryan family have been involved in Ballymore. John Mulryan is a son of Sean Mulryan and the managing director of Ballymore UK, meanwhile, Sean's brother Donal Mulryan used to work for Ballymore before starting his own development company, West Properties, which owns various developments in the UK, including Skyline Central, the tallest apartment complex in Manchester.<ref name=IrishTimes2>irishtimes.com: [http://www.irishtimes.com/business/commercial-property/docklands-project-brings-ballymore-back-to-centre-stage-1.2819321 Docklands project brings Ballymore back to centre stage --]</ref><ref name=BDCMagazine>bdcmagazine.com: [http://www.bdcmagazine.com/building-news/construction-news/housing/8744-8744 Featuring Ballymore: Interview With Sean Mulryan (Chairman & Group Chief Executive) --]</ref>
As of 2012, he is one of the richest men in Ireland.<ref name=HP/> According to London's ''[[The Evening Standard]]'', Mulryan owns more land in London than the [[Gerald Grosvenor, 6th Duke of Westminster|Duke of Westminster]].<ref name=HP/>
On 16 February 2012, Wandsworth Council approved [[Ballymore Group]]'s plans for the 15 acre development in [[Nine Elms]]. [[Embassy Gardens]] is set to provide "up to 1,982 new homes alongside shops, cafes, bars, restaurants, business space, a 100 bed hotel, a health centre, children's playgrounds and sports pitches".<ref name=Wandsworth>Wandsworth Council: [http://www.wandsworth.gov.uk/news/article/11030/embassy_gardens_plans_approved Embassy Gardens plans approved | Wandsworth Council], accessdate: 9 September 2014</ref> In 2014, it was reported that Mulryan had engaged [[Lazard]] and [[CBRE Group]] to raise about €2.5bn to fund the Embassy Gardens development.<ref name=Independent.ie>Independent.ie: [http://www.independent.ie/business/irish/nick-webb-mulryan-is-close-to-wiping-slate-clean-30301129.html Nick Webb: Mulryan is close to wiping slate clean], accessdate: 1 September 2014</ref>
Outside of his work with Ballymore, Mulryan is set to join the board of the Ireland West Airport Knock in 2017.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Quinlan|first1=Ronald|title=Knock Airport to bring Ballymore's Mulryan on board|url=http://www.independent.ie/business/irish/knock-airport-to-bring-ballymores-mulryan-on-board-35687591.html|website=The Irish Independent|accessdate=16 May 2017}}</ref> Knock confirmed the appointment in May 2017, along with two other new Directors. The airport is considered key for regional development and it expects to handle around 750,000 passengers in 2017, making it its busiest year.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/business/transport-and-tourism/sean-mulryan-joins-knock-airport-board-1.3103015|title=Sean Mulryan joins Knock Airport board|work=The Irish Times|access-date=2 June 2017}}</ref>
==Personal life== Mulryan and his wife Bernadine live at the [[Ardenode Stud]], County Kildare, with five children. They are very active in horse racing and own "somewhere between 50 and 100" racehorses, trained in Ireland and France.<ref name=Telegraph/><ref name=SC>Shopping Centre: [http://www.shopping-centre.co.uk/news/archivestory.php/aid/1135/Mulryan_of_many_talents.html Mulryan of many talents], accessdate: 1 September 2014</ref> Among his top horses was Forget the Past, which was a multiple winner at the highest level over jumps and trained by Michael O’Brien, who handled a number of Mulryan-owned horses. He also owned flat horses, including Thewayyouare, which was once considered to be a strong contender for [[Epsom Derby|The Derby]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/business/construction/ballymore-puts-the-building-boom-back-into-horse-racing-1.3047540|title=Ballymore puts the building boom back into horse racing|work=The Irish Times|access-date=8 May 2017}}</ref> In 2017, Mulryan's Ballymore Properties sponsored the headline race on the last day of the [[Punchestown Racecourse|Punchestown]] National Hunt Festival. Worth over €100,000, the Ballymore Handicap Hurdle is run over two and a half miles and is one of the most hotly contested races of the festival.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.kildare-nationalist.ie/2017/04/20/naas-all-set-for-punchestown/|title=Kildare Nationalist – Naas all set for Punchestown|access-date=8 May 2017}}</ref>
His friends include the athlete and politician [[Seb Coe]] and [[Bono]], the singer in the Irish pop group [[U2]]. [[Debbie Harry]], of the pop group [[Blondie (band)|Blondie]] sang at his 50th birthday party.<ref name="Telegraph" />

|1959|1974|end=div}} |partner = |issue = 3, including [[Anthony Radziwill|Anthony Radziwiłł]] |father = [[Janusz Franciszek Radziwiłł]] |mother = Anna, Princess Lubomirska |relations = |signature = |website = |footnotes = }} '''Prince Stanisław Albrecht''' "'''Stash'''" '''Radziwiłł''' (21 July 1914 – 27 July 1976) was a scion of the Polish-Lithuanian princely [[House of Radziwiłł]], born in Szpanów in the [[Volhynian Governorate]] of the [[Russian Empire]] (now Szpaniv, [[Ukraine]]). His parents were [[Janusz Franciszek Radziwiłł|Janusz Franciszek, Prince Radziwiłł]] (1880–1967) and [[House of Lubomirski|Princess Anna Lubomirska]] (1882–1947). Stanisław had two elder brothers, Edmund Radziwiłł (1906–1971) and Ludwik Radziwiłł (1911–1928). Through his father, Stanislaw Albrecht was second cousin twice removed of [[Sophie, Duchess of Hohenberg]], wife of the Heir to the Austro-Hungarian throne [[Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria]]. ==Marriages== Radziwiłł married Countess Rose de Mauléon {{Citation needed|date=December 2017}} (1913–1996),[http://www.ourfamtree.org/browse.cfm/Rose-de-Monleon/p342156 World Family Tree] on 10 April 1940 and they were divorced in 1945. She later married Baron de Chollet, a Swiss banker.{{cite news |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,874456-2,00.html |title=International Set: Unhitching Post |author= |date= 14 September 1962|work= |publisher= [[Time.com]]|accessdate=}} Radziwill married Grace Maria Kolin on 2 May 1946. They were divorced in 1958. The marriage produced one son: *Prince Jan Stanisław Albrycht Radziwill (8 August 1947), who married Eugenia Carras on 14 September 1978. They have two sons and four grandchildren: **Prince Jan Michal Radziwill (29 August 1979) **Prince Filip Radziwill (4 February 1981) he married Devon Schuster on 16 January 2010. They have four children: ***Princess Eugenie Elizabeth Radziwill (24 October 2012) ***Prince Isabella Sophia Radziwill (17 July 2014) ***Princess Arietta Grace Radziwill (17 July 2014) ***Prince Stanislaw Radziwill (2018) Kolin later married [[William Ward, 3rd Earl of Dudley]] (1894–1969) as his third wife,Lundy, Darryl, ed. [http://thepeerage.com/p990.htm#i9899 "Grace Maria Kolin"]. ''ThePeerage.com'', 28 September 2010 and from 1975, she lived with [[Robert B. Silvers]].Scott, Janny. [https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9E04E1DC1630F932A35752C1A961958260&sec=&spon=&pagewanted=1 "Ideas: One Mind, But What A Mind; Defining the Passions Of the Liberal Elite For Over 2 Decades"], ''[[The New York Times]]'', November 1, 1997; Kolhatkar, Sheelah. [http://www.observer.com/node/38123 Profile of Robert Silvers], ''The New York Observer'', December 18, 2005; and [http://www.legacy.com/obituaries/nytimes/obituary.aspx?n=grace&pid=183263650 Death notice], ''The New York Times'', December 31, 2016 Radziwiłł married [[Lee Radziwill|Caroline Lee Bouvier Canfield]] on 19 March 1959. They had two children: *Prince [[Anthony Stanislas Radziwill|Anthony Radziwiłł]] (4 August 1959–10 August 1999) he married [[Carole Radziwill|Carole Ann DiFalco]] on 27 August 1994. *Princess Anna Christina "Tina" Radziwill(18 August 1960) she married Octavio Arancio in September 1999 and they were divorced in 2005. ==Later life== Radziwiłł was one of the organisers of the [[Sikorski Historical Institute]] in [[London]] and founder of St. Anne's Church at [[Fawley Court]], the site of Divine Mercy College, a school for boys of Polish origin, set up by the [[Marian Fathers]] in 1953 near [[Henley-on-Thames]], England. He died on 27 July 1976, in [[London]] at the age of 62. His body was interred in the crypt of St Anne's Church at [[Fawley Court]].{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Prince Radziwill Dead at 62; Ex-Husband of Lee Bouvier |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1976/06/29/archives/prince-radziwill-dead-at-62-exhusband-of-lee-bouvier.html |quote=[[London]], 28 June 1976 (AP) Prince Stanislas Radziwill, former husband of [[Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis]]' younger sister, [[Lee Bouvier]], died yesterday at the home of a friend, sources close to the family reported today. He was 62 years old. |publisher=[[New York Times]] |date=29 June 1976 |accessdate=2007-06-21}} {{As of|2010}} the Marian Fathers were seeking authorisation to exhume the body{{why|date=February 2018}} following the closure of Divine Mercy College (in 1986) and the sale of Fawley Court (2010).{{citation needed|date=February 2018}} ==Title== Upon becoming a British subject and in keeping with standard practice, Radziwiłł would have needed permission to use his princely title from [[Queen Elizabeth II]], but did not receive special dispensation and was known in Britain as ''Mr. Radziwiłł'' legally and as ''Prince Radziwiłł'' by courtesy. ==Ancestry== {{ahnentafel |collapsed=yes |align=center |boxstyle_1=background-color: #fcc; |boxstyle_2=background-color: #fb9; |boxstyle_3=background-color: #ffc; |boxstyle_4=background-color: #bfc; |boxstyle_5=background-color: #9fe; |1= 1. {{Use mdy dates|date=June 2014}} {{Infobox writer <!-- for more information see [[:Template:Infobox writer/doc]] --> | image = Portrait of Thomas Nelson Page.jpg | imagesize = | caption = Portrait of Thomas Nelson Page, by Frances Benjamin Johnston | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date|1853|4|23}} | birth_place = [[Virginia]], U.S. | death_date = {{death date and age|1922|11|1|1853|4|23}} | death_place = Virginia, U.S. | resting_place = Rock Creek Cemetery, Washington, D.C., U.S. | nationality = | citizenship = | education = | alma_mater = | notableworks = | occupation = | spouse = Florence Lathrop Field | partner = | children = | relations = | awards = | signature = Signature of Thomas N. Page.jpg }} '''Thomas Nelson Page''' (April 23, 1853 – November 1, 1922) was a lawyer and American writer.<ref>{{cite magazine|title=PAGE, Thomas Nelson|magazine=The International Who's Who in the World|year=1912|page=829|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=I-wRAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA829}}</ref> He also served as the [[List of United States ambassadors to Italy|U.S. ambassador to Italy]] under the administration of President [[Woodrow Wilson]] during [[World War I]].
==Biography== Born at [[Oakland (Montpelier, Virginia)|Oakland]], one of the Nelson family plantations, in the village of [[Beaverdam, Virginia|Beaverdam]] in [[Hanover County, Virginia]] to John Page, a lawyer and a plantation owner, and Elizabeth Burwell (Nelson).<ref>{{cite book|last=Kunitz|first=Stanley.|title= American Authors 1600-1900. A Biographical Dictionary of American Literature|year=1938|publisher=H.W Wilson|location=New York}}</ref> He was a scion of the prominent Nelson and Page families, each [[First Families of Virginia]]. Although he was from once-wealthy lineage, after the [[American Civil War]], which began when he was only 8 years old, his parents and their relatives were largely impoverished during [[Reconstruction era of the United States|Reconstruction]] and his teenage years. In 1869, he entered Washington College, known now as [[Washington and Lee University]], in [[Lexington, Virginia]] when [[Robert E. Lee]] was president of the college. In Page's later literary works, Robert E. Lee would come to serve as the model figure of Southern Heroism.<ref>{{cite web|last=Simms|first=L. Moody|title=Thomas Nelson Page|url=http://www.anb.org/articles/16/16-01247.html|work=American National Biography Online|accessdate=September 9, 2011}}</ref> Page left Washington College before graduation for financial reasons after three years, but continued to desire an education specifically in law. To earn money to pay for his degree, Page tutored the children of his cousins in Kentucky. From 1873 to 1874, he was enrolled in the law school of the [[University of Virginia]]. At Washington College and thereafter at UVA, Nelson was a member of the prestigious fraternity Delta Psi, AKA St. Anthony Hall.
Admitted to the [[Virginia Bar Association]], he practiced as a lawyer in [[Richmond, Virginia|Richmond]] between 1876 and 1893, and also began his writing career. He was married to Anne Seddon Bruce on July 28, 1886. She died on December 21, 1888 of a throat hemorrhage.
[[File:Thomas Nelson Page in 1916.jpg|thumb|Thomas Nelson Page in 1916.]] He remarried on June 6, 1893, to Florence Lathrop Field, a widowed sister-in-law of retailer [[Marshall Field]]. In the same year Page, who had become disillusioned with the Southern legal system, gave up his practice entirely and moved with his wife to Washington, D.C. There, he kept up his writing, which amounted to eighteen volumes when they were compiled and published in 1912. Page popularized the [[plantation tradition]] genre of Southern writing, which told of an idealized version of life before the Civil War, with contented slaves working for beloved masters and their families. He based much of his writing on his personal experience living on a plantation in the Antebellum South. Page viewed the Antebellum South as a representation of moral purity, and often vilified the reforms of the [[Gilded Age]] as a sign of moral decline.<ref>{{cite book|last=Gross|first=Theodore L.|title=Thomas Nelson Page|year=1967|publisher=Twayne Publishers Inc|location=New York|page=18}}</ref> His 1887 collection of short stories, ''In Ole Virginia'', is Page's quintessential work, which provides an depiction of the Antebellum South. Criticism of Page's works runs the gamut, largely based upon whether the critic holds traditionalist or revisionist viewpoints of the antebellum South, War and Reconstruction years. His most well-known short-story from that collection was "Marse Chan." "Marse Chan" was popularized because of Page's ability to capture southern dialect.<ref>{{cite book|last=Kunitz|first=Stanley.|title= American Authors 1600-1900. A Biographical Dictionary of American Literature|year=1938|publisher=H.W Wilson|location=New York}}</ref> Another short-story collection of his is entitled ''The Burial of the Guns'' (1894). As a result of his literary success, Page was popular amongst the Capital elite, and was regularly invited to socialize with politicians from around the country.<ref name="Dauer, Richard Paul 1972">Dauer, Richard Paul. "Thomas Nelson Page, Diplomat" (MA, College of William and Mary, 1972)</ref> During the first quarter of the 20th century, he founded a library in the [[Sycamore Tavern]] structure near Montpelier, Virginia, in memory of his wife, Florence Lathrop Page.<ref name="vaNRHPnom">{{cite web |url=http://www.dhr.virginia.gov/registers/Counties/Hanover/042-0085_Sycamore_Tavern_1974_Final_Nomination.pdf |title=National Register of Historic Places Inventory/Nomination: Sycamore Tavern |author=Virginia Historic Landmarks Commission staff| date=January 1974|publisher=Virginia Department of Historic Resources}}</ref>
Under President [[Woodrow Wilson]], Page was appointed as [[List of United States ambassadors to Italy|U.S. ambassador to Italy]] for six years between 1913 and 1919. Despite being untrained in Italian and having little experience in governmental affairs, Page was determined to do a good job. He eventually learned Italian, formed beneficial relationships with Italian government officials, and accurately reported on the Italian state during [[World War I]].<ref name="Dauer, Richard Paul 1972"/> During his time as ambassador Page managed to maintain and improve American-Italian relations during [[World War I]], and provided a sympathetic ear to the Italian and Triple Entente cause in the U.S government. After a disagreement with President Wilson over the terms of the [[Treaty of Versailles]], in which he argued for increased Italian benefits, Page resigned his post in 1919. His book entitled ''Italy and the World War'' (1920) is a memoir of his service there.
Returning to his home in Oakland, Virginia, Page continued to write for the remainder of his years. He died in 1922 at Oakland in Hanover County, Virginia.
==Historical sites== Page was an activist in stimulating the [[Association for the Preservation of Virginia Antiquities]] to mobilize to save historical sites at [[Yorktown, Virginia|Yorktown]] and elsewhere, especially in the [[Historic Triangle of Virginia]], from loss to development. He was involved in gaining Federal funding to build a [[seawall]] at [[Jamestown, Virginia|Jamestown]] in 1900, protecting a site where the remains of James Fort were later discovered by [[archeology|archaeologists]] working on the [[Jamestown Rediscovery]] project which began in 1994.
==Family== [[File:Thomas Nelson Page House - Washington, D.C..JPG|thumb|The [[Thomas Nelson Page House]] in the [[Dupont Circle]] neighborhood of Washington, D.C. is listed on the [[National Register of Historic Places]].]] The Page and Nelson families were each among the [[First Families of Virginia]]. The Page lineage in Virginia began with the arrival at Jamestown of [[John Page (Middle Plantation)|Colonel John Page]] at [[Jamestown, Virginia|Jamestown]] in 1650. Col. Page was a prominent founder of [[Middle Plantation (Virginia)|Middle Plantation]], which was later renamed [[Williamsburg, Virginia|Williamsburg]]. The Page family included [[Mann Page]], U.S. Congressman and Governor [[John Page (Virginia)|John Page]]. The Nelson lineage began with [[Thomas "Scotch Tom" Nelson]], a Scottish immigrant who settled at [[Yorktown, Virginia|Yorktown]], and his son, William Nelson, who was a royal governor of Virginia. Thomas Nelson Page was a direct descendant of [[Thomas Nelson, Jr.]], a signer of the [[United States Declaration of Independence|Declaration of Independence]] and a governor after Statehood, and thus of [[Robert Carter I|Robert "King" Carter]], who served as an acting royal governor of Virginia and was one of its wealthiest landowners in the late 17th and early 18th centuries. The Nelson family had settled in Hanover County, where Thomas's mother Elizabeth Burwell Nelson, married John Page.
A contemporary cousin of Thomas Nelson Page was [[William Nelson Page]] (1854–1932), who became a civil engineer and mining manager had helped develop the natural resources of western Virginia and southern West Virginia in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. William Page is credited with, in partnership with millionaire financier [[Henry H. Rogers|Henry Huttleston Rogers]], planning and [[Building the Virginian Railway]]. His family's Victorian-era mansion, the [[Page-Vawter House]] in [[Ansted, West Virginia]], is a [[National Historical Landmark]] as is a former [[company store]] of the Page Coal and Coke Company in [[Pageton, West Virginia|Pageton]].Other cousins were Confederate officers [[Robert Edward Lee]] and [[Richard Lucian Page]]
The ruins of [[Rosewell Plantation]], the home of early members of the Page family and one of the finest mansions built in the colonies, sit on the banks of the [[York River (Virginia)|York River]] in [[Gloucester County, Virginia|Gloucester County]]. In 1916, a fire swept the mansion leaving a magnificent shell which is testament to 18th century craftsmanship and dreams. There are ongoing [[archeology|archaeological]] studies at the site.
==Writing themes== Thomas Nelson Page was one of the best-known writers of his day. He served as Woodrow Wilson's ambassador to Italy, and the president referred to him as a "national ornament".<ref>Abbott, Shirley. Womenfolks, growing up down South. New Haven, Conn.: Ticknor & Fields, 1983. Print.</ref>
[[File:Thomas Nelson Page 2.jpg|thumb|left|280px|Thomas Nelson Page, 1903.]] Page's postbellum fiction featured a nostalgic view of the South in step with what is termed [[Lost Cause]] ideology. Slaves are happy and simple, slotted into a paternalistic society. For example, the former slave in Marse Chan is uneducated, speaks phonetically, and has unrelenting admiration for his former master.<ref>{{cite book|last=Page|first=Thomas Nelson|title=Marse Chan excerpted from in Ole Virginia |publisher=Charles Scribner's Sons, 1887}}</ref> The gentry are noble and principled, with fealty to country and to chivalry—they seem like knights of a different age. The strain epitomized by Page would carry through the postwar era, cropping up again in art with films like ''[[Birth of a Nation]]''. The ideology and thoughts that appear in Page's writing and in Southern ideology are no mere simplistic, archaic world-view; they are part of a complex history that has informed, for worse and for better, the evolution of the Southern mind to today.<ref>{{cite book|last=Cash|first=W.J.|title=Mind of the South|publisher=Vintage}}</ref>
Thomas Nelson Page lamented that the slavery-era "good old darkies" had been replaced by the "new issue" (blacks born after slavery) whom he described as "lazy, thriftless, intemperate, insolent, dishonest, and without the most rudimentary elements of morality" (pp. 80, 163). Page, who helped popularize the images of cheerful and devoted Mammies and Sambos in his early books, became one of the first writers to introduce a literary black brute. In 1898 he published ''Red Rock'', a [[Reconstruction Era|Reconstruction]] novel, with the heinous figure of Moses, a loathsome and sinister black politician. Moses tried to rape a white woman: "He gave a snarl of rage and sprang at her like a wild beast" (pp. 356–358). He was later lynched for "a terrible crime".
[[File:Photo of Thomas Nelson Page.jpg|thumb|right|210px|Thomas Nelson Page.]] Page dealt with the morality of [[lynching]] by acquitting the mob from any guilt, holding, instead, the supposedly debased Negroes responsible for their own violent executions. The following excerpts are taken from Page's essay, "The Negro: The Southerner's Problem," published in 1904. Page expected his reader to read his entire book with care before making judgments on complex, difficult subjects, in accordance with a society that read in depth. In his words in his introduction:
{{quote|In this discussion, one thing must be borne in mind: In characterizing the Negroes generally, it is not meant to include the respectable element among them, except where this is plainly intended. Throughout the South there is such an element, an element not only respectable, but universally respected.<ref>[https://archive.org/stream/negrosoutherners00page#page/n7/mode/2up ''The Negro.''] New York: Charles Scribner's Sons, pp. xi.</ref>}}
With that in mind, Page's works include the following for which the disclaimer was necessary:
{{quote|Lynching does not end ravishing, and that is the prime necessity... The charge that is often made, that the innocent are sometimes lynched, has little foundation. The rage of a mob is not directed against the innocent, but against the guilty; and its fury would not be satisfied with any other sacrifices than the death of the real criminal. Nor does the criminal merit any consideration, however terrible the punishment. The real injury is to the perpetrators of the crime of destroying the law, and to the community in which the law is slain... The crime of lynching is not likely to cease until the crime of ravishing and murdering women and children is less frequent than it has been of late. And this crime, which is well-nigh wholly confined to the Negro race, will not greatly diminish until the Negroes themselves take it in hand and stamp it out... As the crime of rape of late years had its baleful renascence in the teaching of equality and the placing of power in the ignorant Negroes' hands, so its perpetuation and increase have undoubtedly been due in large part to the same teaching. The intelligent Negro may understand what social equality truly means, but to the ignorant and brutal young Negro, it signifies but one thing: the opportunity to enjoy, equally with white men, the privilege of [[Anti-miscegenation laws in the United States|cohabiting with white women]].<ref>Page, Thomas Nelson (1904). [https://archive.org/stream/negrosoutherners00page#page/n7/mode/2up ''The Negro.''] New York: Charles Scribner's Sons, pp. xi, 108, 109, 111, 112–113.</ref>}}
Likewise, Thomas Nelson Page complained that African American leaders should cease "talk of social equality that inflames the ignorant Negro,"<ref name="Page 1904, p. 111">Page (1904), p. 111.</ref> and instead, work to stop "the crime of ravishing and murdering women and children."<ref name="Page 1904, p. 111"/>

Lee: The Southerner'' (1908). * ''Mount Vernon and Its Preservation, 1858-1910'' (1910). * ''Robert E. Lee: Man and Soldier'' (1911). * ''The Land of the Spirit'' (1913). * ''The Page Story Book'' (1914). * ''The Stranger's Pew'' (1914). * ''The Shepherd Who Watched by Night'' (1916). * ''Address at the Three Hundredth Anniversary of the Settlement of Jamestown'' (1919). * ''Italy and the World War'' (1920). * ''Dante and His Influence'' (1922). * ''The Red Riders'' (1924).
'''Selected articles''' * [http://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id=hvd.32044014695910;view=1up;seq=13 "Lee in Defeat,"] ''The South Atlantic Quarterly,'' Vol. VI (1907). * [http://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id=hvd.32044039029145;view=1up;seq=93 "The Spirit of a People Manifested in their Art,"] ''Art and Progress,'' Vol. II (1910). * [http://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id=mdp.39015017528913;view=1up;seq=269 "Our Relation to Art,"] ''The American Magazine of Art,'' Vol. XIII (1922).
'''Collected works''' * ''The Novels, Stories, Sketches and Poems of Thomas Nelson Page'' (18 vols., 1910–12). {{div col end}}
==See also== *[[Thomas Nelson Page House]], listed on the National Register of Historic Places

revision.text:
This Wikipedia page deals with various aspects '''UAE company formation''' in [[Dubai]] and other emirates in [[United Arab Emirates|UAE]].
==Types of Business License==
The types of Business Licenses issued in Dubai and other emirates in United Arab Emirates (UAE) are professional, commercial and industrial. The professional license covers services offered by professionals, artisans and craftsmen; the commercial license covers all trading and commercial activities performed with an intention of making profit ; the industrial license covers all industrial and manufacturing activities. The type of license depends on the business activity of the company or enterprise.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.baijumasoodu.com/articles/details/39|title=Types of Business License|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=|access-date=12 December 2016}}</ref>
==Jurisdiction of the Company==
In UAE, a company can be formed in any of the following three jurisdictions: Mainland, Free Zone and Offshore. The licensing authority in mainland is the Department of Economic Development of the respective emirates. In Free Zones, the relevant Free Zone Authority will be the licensing authority and respective Offshore Authority in the case of Offshore jurisdiction.
==Legal Forms of Business== The common legal forms of business in the UAE are: * [[Sole proprietorship]] * Civil Company * [[Limited liability company|Limited Liability Company]] (LLC) * [[Partnership]] * Private Share [[Holding company|Holding Company]] * [[Share (finance)|Public Share]] Holding Company * Branches * Representative Offices Under UAE Law, there are five types of business establishments applicable to foreign entities interested in establishing a formal presence in the UAE. UAE government has implemented wide range of economic and administrative policies which has made UAE an attractive business destination.
A company can create a permanent establishment, create an entity in a UAE free zone, enter into a commercial agency agreement, establish a branch office, create a civil company (currently possible to establish a company in Dubai,<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.worldwideformations.com/free-zone-incorporation/dubai|title=Business Setup in Dubai FreeZone {{!}} Dubai Freezone Company Formation {{!}} WWFL|work=WWFL|access-date=2018-02-22|language=en-US}}</ref> Sharjah <ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.worldwideformations.com/free-zone-incorporation/sharjah|title=Sharjah Freezone Incorporation {{!}}Company Registration Sharjah {{!}}WWFL|work=WWFL|access-date=2018-02-22|language=en-US}}</ref> and Ajman<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.worldwideformations.com/free-zone-incorporation/ajman|title=Ajman Freezone {{!}}Company Formation & Registration in Ajma FreeZone {{!}}WWFL|work=WWFL|access-date=2018-02-22|language=en-US}}</ref>).
=== Limited Liability Company ===
A [[Limited Liability Company]] (LLC) is the most common type of registration in the UAE and is recommended where the purpose of the entity is to make sales within the region. However, it should be noted that 100% foreign ownership of such an entity is not permitted. Under the UAE Commercial Companies Law (CCL), foreign investors are permitted to hold up to 49 per cent equity ownership in UAE companies and 51 per cent of the equity must be held at all times by one or more UAE nationals.
In accordance with Article (218) of the CCL a Limited Liability Company can be formed by a minimum of 1 (as per Article 8 of the Federal Commercial Company Law of 2015) and a maximum of 50 [[shareholders]] whose liability is limited to their shares in the capital of the company. Recent amendments to Article (217) of the CCL that came into force in June 2009 removed the requirement for minimum [[share capital]] (previously AED 300,000 in Dubai and AED 150,000 in other Emirates) allowing founders of a limited liability company the freedom to determine the company’s share capital which could be less than the earlier prescribed bottom line.
A LLC must appoint a minimum of one manager and up to a maximum of five managers for the business. Managers must be appointed by a [[Memorandum of Association]] or by a management contract, for a fixed term or an unlimited term. Unless the Memorandum of Association states otherwise, the manager has full powers of administration and management of the LLC. LLC is not allowed to practice its activities in the UAE without a Trade License and Commercial Registration Certificate.
=== Free Zone Company ===
Establishing a business entity in one of the UAE's many [[Free trade zone]]s (FTZs) can be an attractive option for foreign investors. UAE has over 35 FTAs of which more than 20 are located in Dubai. The main attraction for setting up a company in a free zone is that there is no UAE national shareholding required. All free zones in UAE offer the following incentives: * 100% foreign ownership of the enterprises * 100% cent import and export tax exemptions * 100% repatriation of capital and profits * No currency restrictions * [[Corporate tax]] exemption for 15 years, renewable for an additional 15 years * No personal [[income taxes]]
UAE Free Zone companies can only operate within the free zone boundaries and are generally limited to performing solely those activities listed in their license(s).
It is mandatory for every company registered in the Free Zone to lease minimum office space within that particular Free Zone. A Free Zone Company can obtain UAE residence visas for the director, shareholder and also employees of the company through the Free Zone where it is registered.
=== Offshore Company ===
UAE [[Offshore company]] registration is a very popular method of doing business in the Middle East region. In UAE there are three offshore jurisdictions – Dubai (Jebel Ali Offshore Company) [[Ras Al Khaimah]]and Ajman. They offer similar services but serve different strategic goals of offshore company registration.The Jebel Ali Offshore Company is an International Business Crown/holds the only offshore vehicle that is permitted to own / hold real estate in the Emirate of Dubai.
The RAK Offshore and the RAK International Company (RAKIC) are International Business Companies. They provide a flexible and credible option for foreign investors to register an offshore company in UAE without the need to establish a physical presence in the UAE.
UAE Offshore companies offer the following benefits: * No Corporate tax * 100% foreign ownership * Limited Liability Company * No TIEAs * Absolute Privacy and Confidentiality * Ability to maintain multi-currency Bank accounts in the UAE * Virtual office facilities available in the UAE
=== Branch / Representative Office ===
A branch office has the same legal identity as its [[parent company]] and conducts business under the name of its parent company. A branch office may only be engaged in activities similar to those of its parent company but it is not permitted to carry on the business of importing the products of its parent company, a function reserved for local trade agents. In some cases the Branch of a foreign company are required to obtain an additional license from UAE Ministry of Economy.
[[Representative office]], on the other hand, is limited to promoting its parent company’s activities i.e. gathering information and soliciting orders and projects to be performed by the company’s head office.
A UAE national must be appointed as a ‘service agent’ for the branch or representative office.
=== Civil Company ===
A civil company is a business partnership for professionals like doctors, lawyers, engineers and accountants. A civil company is 100% owned by the professional partners (except for engineering civil company), however, a UAE National Local Service Agent is normally required. A foreign company can be a partner in a civil company, as long as the foreign company is in the same field as the civil company.
== See also ==
{{Empty section|date=April 2018}}

| signature_alt = | footnotes = }} '''Johnathan ‘Yoni’ Alexander Assia''' is an [[Israeli people|Israeli]] [[entrepreneur]], [[inventor]] and [[Founder CEO|founding CEO]] of [[financial technology]] [[Startup company|startup]] and [[social trading]] platform [[eToro]]. ==Biography== Assia obtained a [[bachelor's degree]] in [[management]] and [[computer science]] with the [[Open University]] in 2005, and a [[master’s degree]] in computer science from the [[Interdisciplinary Center Herzliya]] in 2007.{{cite web |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=52739961&privcapId=52341425 |title=Executive Profile: Johnathan Alexander Assia |author= |date= |website=[[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg]] |publisher= |access-date=2018-09-24}} In 2003, Assia co-founded ''CDRide'', a startup which developed a system to film people on [[Roller coaster|roller-coasters]] and wirelessly transmit the footage to a booth where it could be purchased by the rider. The company won several large contracts, including one with [[Paramount Parks]]. Assia was appointed to the board of the [[Bancor protocol]] in May 2017.{{cite web |url=https://www.financemagnates.com/cryptocurrency/news/etoro-founder-yoni-assia-joins-bancor-protocol-advisory-board/ |title=eToro Founder Yoni Assia Joins Bancor Protocol Advisory Board |author=Avi Mizrahi |date=2017-05-25|website=[[Finance Magnates]] |publisher= |access-date=2018-10-08}} ===eToro=== {{Main|eToro}} Assia founded eToro in 2006 together with his brother Ronen Assia and David Ring.{{cite web |url=https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/etoro |title=eToro overview |author= |date= |website=[[Crunchbase]] |publisher= |access-date=2018-09-24 |quote=Founders: David Ring, Ronen Assia, Yoni Assia}} The social trading platform enables users to watch and copy the investment patterns of successful users, as well as perform [[cryptocurrency]] trading,{{cite web |url=https://www.financemagnates.com/forex/brokers/etoros-ceo-yoni-assia-trading-cryptocurrencies-future-finance/ |title=eToro’s CEO Yoni Assia on Trading Cryptocurrencies and the Future of Finance |author=Victor Golovtchenko |date=2018-02-13 |website=[[Finance Magnates]] |publisher= |access-date=2018-09-24 |quote=We have decided to offer physical cryptocurrency trading on eToro.}} supporting a range of crypocurrencies.{{cite web |url=https://www.businessinsider.com/ico-dotcom-bubble-yoni-assia-etoro-crypto-blockchain-joseph-lubin-bitcoin-ethereum-2018-6 |title=The crypto boom is like the dotcom bubble but that's not a bad thing: 'Selling crypto now is like selling Apple in 2001' |author=Oscar Williams-Grut |date=2018-06-16 |website=[[Business Insider]] |publisher= |access-date=2018-09-24 |quote=Yoni Assia, the CEO of eToro, a social trading platform that supports a range of cryptocurrencies}} As of 2018, eToro had more than 10 million [[Registered user|registered users]]{{cite web |url=http://citywire.co.uk/wealth-manager/news/etoro-signs-premier-league-giants-to-bitcoin-backed-ad-deal/a1148688 |title=eToro signs Premier League giants to bitcoin-backed ad deal |author=Robin Amos |date=2018-08-22 |website=[[Citywire]] |publisher= |access-date=2018-09-24 |quote=eToro has more than 10 million registered users}} and had raised [[United States dollar|US$]]162M.{{cite web |url=http://www.finsmes.com/2018/03/etoro-raises-100m-in-series-e-funding.html |title=eToro Raises $100m in Series E Funding |author= |date=2018-03-21 |website=FinSMEs |publisher= |access-date=2018-09-24 |quote=The round – which brings the total capital raised to date to $162m...}} ===Colored Coins=== In 2013, Assia invented [[Colored coin|colored coins]], a class of methods for associating real world [[asset]]s with addresses on the [[bitcoin network]].{{cite web|title=Yoni Assia|url=https://blockchainbios.com/yoniassia.html|author=T. Wassenaar|accessdate=2 October 2018|website=[[Github]]|quote=He is also the inventor of bitcoin 2.0’s Colored Coins}}{{cite web|title=eToro CEO Joins Board at Bitcoin Startup Colu|url=https://www.coindesk.com/etoro-board-director-bitcoin-startu-colu/|author=Pete Rizzo|date=16 February 2015|accessdate=2 October 2018|website=[[CoinDesk]]|quote=Assia is credited as one of the originators of the concept of colored coins}} ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== * [https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=52739961&privcapId=52341425 Yoni Assia] on [[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg]] * [https://www.crunchbase.com/person/yoni-assia Yoni Assia] on [[Crunchbase]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Assia, Yoni}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alumni of the Open University]] [[Category:Interdisciplinary Center Herzliya alumni]] [[Category:Israeli businesspeople]] [[Category:Israeli company founders]] [[Category:1980s births]] {{Business-bio-stub}}
